subject: Re: [junit] New user can't post to forum
msgSnippet: Agreed and acknowledged that current behavior is wrong.  I believe it was right in the past, and will make sure it becomes right in the near future.  :-) David
messageBody:
Agreed and acknowledged that current behavior is wrong. I believe it
was right in the past, and will make sure it becomes right in the near
future. :-)

David Saff

On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 11:34 AM, David Balažic <xerces9@...> wrote:
> No, there is no notice.
> There is a login link, then a "register new user" link. It takes the account
> data, sends a conifrmation email etc...
> Only after logging in all posting is disabled.
>
> David
>
> On 8 March 2010 15:45, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> David,
>>
>> Those forums were purposely shut down, in favor of this mailing list,
>> but the archives were left up as search-engine targets. I thought the
>> home page of the forums used to have a very prominent notice to this
>> effect. I'll look into it.
>>
>> David Saff
>>
>>
>> On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 6:37 AM, David Balažic <xerces9@...<xerces9%40gmail.com>>
>> wrote:
>> > (not sure where else to send this)
>> >
>> > Hi!
>> >
>> > I created a new user account at http://www.junit.org/forum/ and after
>> > login it says on all pages:
>> > You are not allowed to post a new forum topic.
>> >
>> > Is this normal? There is no explanation to be found about this.
>> >
>> > For the actual reason I subscribed, I'll post a separate message.
>> >
>> > Regards,
>> > David
>> >
>> >
>> > ------------------------------------
>> >
>> > Yahoo! Groups Links
>> >
>> >
>> >
>> >
>>
>>
